definition: lit. one-track path; fig. to adopt a unified approach to discussing an issue/to sing from the same hymn-sheet
to gather/to unite/to unify/whole
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
footpath/track/diameter/straight/directly

sentences.english: And maintaining unified leadership by the Central Committee is interpreted as "doing everything according to unified standards".
sentences.chinese: 坚持中央的统一领导，变成了“一切统一口径”。

definition: all of one voice/unanimous
(idiom) reluctant to speak about it/tight-lipped
to refuse to say anything about (idiom)/to remain tight-lipped/to avoid mentioning
to deny flatly
actual situation/truth
lit. to guard one's mouth like a closed bottle (idiom); tight-lipped/reticent/not breathing a word
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
to arbitrarily assert/to allege/to stick to one's statement/to cling to one's view
clear (of liquid)/limpid/to clarify/to make sth clear/to be clear (about the facts)
to settle (of liquid)/to become clear (by precipitation of impurities)/precipitate (chemistry)/to put in order/to quell disturbances
to say a matter has no relationship with the individual referred to, to emphasise one is innocent or in the clear
in private
excuse/pretext/entreaties/arguments
lips sealed and not saying anything (idiom); fig. to omit mention (of a non-person or embarrassing topic)/to censor
to consult/to talk over/to discuss
a tacit mutual understanding
not to mention (idiom); to say not one word/fig. to omit mention (of a non-person or embarrassing topic)/to censor
